OverviewInfo.Overview_Title: Powering  Bahia expects  to  electrify  10,000  households,  using  a  combination  of  wind  and  solar  minigrids,  inover  5  years,  resulting  in  a  net  present  value  of  $9million  in  social  benefits.  And  for  every  $1  invested  in  this  project  there  is  an  average  of  $3.2  in  social  benefits.

Listing.Project_Name: Ensure  access  to  affordable,  reliable,  sustainable  and  modern  energy  for all
Promote  sustained,  inclusive  and  sustainable  economic  growth,  full  and  productive  employment  and  decent  work  for  all
Make  cities  and  human  settlements  inclusive,  resilient  and  sustainable for all

Summary_Section.Summary: Developing  Power  expects  to  electrify  91,000  households  over  15  years,  resulting  in  a  net  present  value  of  $93  million  in  social  benefits.  And  for  every  $1  invested  in  a  Developing  Power  project  there  is  an  average  of  $3.2  in  social  benefits.

Points: Lighting  for  reading,  studying,  and  longer  business  hours
Power  for  water  pumping,  refrigeration,  entertainment,  communications,  machinery,  electrical  devices

The  benefits  assessed  in  the  analysis  are  grouped  into  education  and  earning  potential,  productivity,  the  environment,  communications  and  entertainment,  and  human  health.  To  avoid  double-counting  of  the  benefits  from  access  to  lower-cost  lighting,  it  is  assumed  that  lighting  benefits  are  reflected  in  the  above  measures.

The  estimates  presented  are  for  villages  that  previously  did  not  have  electricity,  where  the  benefits  represent  the  incremental  benefits  of  acquiring  access  to  electricity  compared  to  the  baseline  of  kerosene  and  batteries

The  benefits  are  quantified  for  15  years  because  the  expectation  is  that  the  villages  electrified  through  Developing  Power  will  not  likely  receive  grid  connection  over  that  time  period.

Listing.Description: The world's largest technical professional organization for the advancement of technology. It has 400,000+ Members in 190+ Countries
RoleInvolved: Providing Technical Assessment and Opinion on the Power Generation and Distribution Plan
Mobilizing local volunteers in sharing technical insights

Listing.Title: Transterra Media
Listing.Description: We are an open content marketplace, community and global production studio for editorial and documentary visual storytelling. For brands, channels, and charities -- everyone who produces extraordinary, real-world stories has a home at Transterra Media. Publishers and brands can create and manage original story assignments, purchase and license video features, photo essays and rare footage or search our network of 4000+ filmmakers, video journalists, photographers, and production support teams.
RoleInvolved: Mobilizing the global community of 20K Journalists

Listing.Title: Institute of Management Accountants
Listing.Description:
The Institute of Management Accountants (IMA) is a professional membership organization headquartered in Montvale, New Jersey, United States, operating in four global regions: The Americas, Asia/Pacific, Europe, and the Middle East/India.[2]
IMA members are represented in 140 countries around the world with 300 professional and student chapters.[3] Members work in business, with job responsibilities distinct from those in public accounting. IMA raises awareness of management accounting, which includes jobs in decision support, planning and control positions.
With a global network of more than 100,000[4] professionals, IMA provides certification, the Certified Management Accountant (CMA), for internal financial management responsibilities, including planning, budgeting, business reporting, decision analysis and risk management.
RoleInvolved: Mobilize members around the world in due diligence of the impact measurement and reporting.

Sustainability.FinancialSustainability: The price paid by the metered kWh power consumption costs would pay for the operational expenses and a portion of the capital investment in the form of net surplus each year.
Sustainability.OpereationalSustainability: Bahia Electricity Board will be overtaking the operations and maintenance of this project once completed.
